Job Description Summary

As Government Contracting & Compliance Consultant, you will work closely with internal business partners and lead compliance related to federal government awards and audits across the enterprise.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Key responsibilities will include:

Contract compliance :  Responsible for contract compliance across all contract awards, making recommendations to leadership to reduce risk, and execution of compliance improvement initiatives

  • Project Manage compliance improvement initiatives across the Government Contracts team
  • Monitor SOX controls to ensure compliance and recommend enhancements aligned with evolving business practice
  • Regularly audit Commercial Sales Practices (CSP), including pricing analyses and “what if” scenarios to determine financial impact of business proposals
  • Manage TAA solicitation, reporting, and execution of modifications to ensure awards are origin compliant
  • Manage discontinued product/recall product reporting and execution of modifications to ensure awards are compliant
  • Maintain FAR clause library and coordinate activity to ensure contract compliance
  • Review CLM data dashboard for data integrity flags and manage corrective actions
  • Identify system solutions that reduce compliance risk while improving process
  • Recommend process improvements that align to best in class business practice for contract compliance
  • Lead audit activities to execute tasks as required to include coordination of sales reporting,  completing reporting analysis, and completing questionnaires.

Data Management:

  • Process reporting needs for compliance and contractual requirements
  • Utilize available data management systems to e nsure appropriate document retention in accordance with BD document retention policy in CLM
  • Coordinates Commercial Sales Practices (CSP) reporting and conducts analytics for internal/external audits and business proposals/modifications
  • Recommend reporting enhancements to improve end user experience
  • Interpret reporting output to end users operating as a trusted advisor and develop job aids to support end users

Contract Lifecycle Management: Strong understanding and functional knowledge of the full lifecycle of contracts. Assists with contract solicitation, post award, extension, and closeout procedures.  Supports contracting strategy and analysis based on business need.

  • Track and report all assigned contracts in Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) system
  • Develop a project plan to managing tasks and due dates with business partners, updating trackers as needed, and communicating project status to management
  • Lead communication between Government Contracting Officers and internal business units
  • Review FAR and other government clauses and verify origin compliance
  • Prepare final response package through collaboration with key business partners
  • Responsible for ongoing follow up of the submitted offer until award has been made
  • Identify, create, monitor, and update contract obligations for each contract assigned in CLM
  • Review and process any standard modifications (Product Add/Delete, Price Increase/Decrease, Customer Add/Delete, Administrative Changes), mass modifications, contract extensions, and/or contract closeout requests from customers
  • Ensure appropriate document retention in accordance with BD document retention policy in CLM
  • Collaborate with Federal Sales and Leadership on ways to support contracting growth and ensure compliance

About you: To be successful in this role, you require:

  • Minimum BA/BS required with 5 years of business experience, and four years of government contracts experience, or without a bachelor degree, 10+ years extensive experience in the applicable area preferred.
  • Strong contracting strategy approach with the ability to assess situation, collect data and deliver well thought out recommendations
  • Demonstrated leadership skills; ability to project manage complex Government contracts from beginning to end
  • Proven track record to quickly establish credibility, trust, and support within all levels of organization
  • Strong customer-centric skills, and able to adapt to customer needs while maintaining protection of BD’s interests
  • Strong communication and organizational change experience; must have the ability to develop, present and defend ideas and strategy to internal leaders and partners
  • A high level of comfort with Excel and Salesforce.com

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with FSS, GSA, and/or DAPA contracts
  • Experience with managing contracts through the full contract lifecycle
  • Experience partnering with Sales on contractual negotiation
  • SalesForces.com experience to include reporting
  • Power BI experience preferred
  • Strong Excel Skills (V lookups, pivot tables, etc)
  • Experience with FAR, DFARS, and/or VAARs clause reviews
  • Experience with federal solicitations
  • Experience in military medical logistics

Job Description Summary

Job Family Summary

Product Implementation is responsible for installing a wide range of products and services that involve extensive customer interaction.

What is expected of you for success in your role
1. Manages technical implementation and upgrade of Medical Devices including Infusion Pumps and Patient Monitors
2. Conducts detailed conference calls with customer’s to plan onsite projects
3. Manages temporary and third-party employees during implementation of service products
4. Travels to accounts to be the primary interface with the customer during service product implementations
5. Ensures the efficiency, accuracy, and completeness of implementation of service products and records
6. Installs and configures hardware, software, and network products at customer locations
7. Conducts biomedical training at customer locations
8. Supports field sales activities by providing technical assistance when requested by sales management. May make technical presentations at sales meetings and customer locations in support of sales activities
9. Assists with management and creation of department processes and procedures

Qualifications
1. Bachelors or Associates degree in Engineering or Computer Sciences. Minimum of 2 to 5 years’ experience performing installations of medical equipment and software applications; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Background in field service of medical devices desired.
2. Ability to manage teams of up to 12 (temporary, or third-party suppliers)
3. Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers.
4. Strong written and verbal communication skills
5. Ability to learn and understand detailed product knowledge of medical devices, software, and basic networking
6. Ability to perform moderately complex hardware and software troubleshooting
7. Possesses strong time management skills; works effectively without direct supervision

Job Title: Sr. Customer Experience (Cx) Specialist – Contract Operations
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Contract Operations, this position functions as the liaison between Business Units, customers, and other internal functions to problem solve with a continuous improvement mindset. Responsible for removing challenges and hurdles experienced by customers, business unit leaders, and sales associates when interfacing within the BD matrix. Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to provide Contract Operations expertise in process, systems, and policies to ensure effective work procedures are implemented to quickly resolve contract pricing and/or membership related gaps. Seeks and implements efficient ways to ensure improved cycle and response times. This role will support price accuracy across all customer segments. This associate will have opportunity to collaborate with team members to standardize audits and support overall efficiencies in pricing accuracy within Contracting Operations.

Candidate must have a growth mindset, a powerful desire for continuous improvement, and an “attitude for better.” Candidate should also have effective communication, technical, and organizational skills and be accountable for tracking and achieving key metrics.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the creativity and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find ground-breaking solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Essential Responsibilities

Subject Matter Expertise:

  • An expert in Contract Price and Membership management in identified ERP.

  • Runs the addition and removal of member accounts from agreements efficiently across multiple ERP platforms (SAP Vistex, JDE), demonstrating BOTs and other automation.

  • Conduct root cause analysis and resolve error prevention solutions.

  • Document, maintain, and centralize any membership related pricing exceptions into contracting playbooks.

  • Provide SME to help drive the design and implementation of solutions that improve accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency in contracting set-up/maintenance processes.

  • Ensure adherence to regulatory (SOX), business and department guidelines, policies, and procedures.

Collaboration:

  • Collaborate with Claims and Account Receivables on any pricing issues requiring credit and rebills, copies of credit memos, etc.

  • Collaborate with cross functional operations teams (Offer Development, Analytics, Chargebacks, Customer Care, etc.) to investigate and resolve pricing related matters.

  • Facilitate and lead external/internal calls to quickly gather vital details to resolve stakeholder and customer requests timely.

  • Identify and share data insights with key business stakeholders to address existing issues/gaps resulting from local and/or GPO contract price offerings and propose viable solutions.

  • Act with an enterprise-wide view, ensuring broader considerations and the customer experience are contemplated.

  • Bring up to Contract Operations leadership when deadlines will not be met.

Leadership:

  • Primary Point of Contact for supported Business Units for process issue determination, impact and resolution for sales leaders and customers as it relates to customer contract pricing.

  • Implement opportunities to improve the overall customer experience.

  • Understand and support business and membership strategies to optimally communicate customer pricing eligibility on GPO and/or local agreement requests.

  • Participate and support Continuous Improvement projects and organization initiatives.

  • Be accountable for key metrics, KPI’s (key performance indicators), SLA’s (service level agreements), and Individual Impact Goals to meet the strategic goals of the organization.

  • Influence without authority across enterprise to find and operationalize solutions

Qualifications

  • BA/BS or equivalent experience (required)

  • 2-4 years’ experience in commercial contract operations and/or related areas

  • General understanding of end-to-end commercial processes, including customer pricing

  • Proven understanding and/or experience with Claims and Accounts Receivables

  • Excellent understanding of SAP, JDE & BI

  • Advanced Excel skills with the ability to manipulate large data to draw insights, apply Data Mining tools; SAP BI, Power BI, & QlikView

  • Strong organizational and prioritization skills

  • Effective communication skills

  • Comfortable interacting with many levels of management, sales, and end customers

  • Must be motivated, self-directed, and able to work with minimal direction.

  • Effectively builds and maintains strong cross-functional business partner relationships.

  • Demonstrates a growth mindset to identify opportunities for continuous improvement to drive value.

Key Competencies

  • Process Effectiveness

  • Stakeholder Engagement

  • Strategic Partnership and Customer Support

  • Accountability and Empowerment

  • Analytical and Problem-Solving Orientation

  • Working Across Functions

Job Title: US Marketing Manager, Foley Alternatives - Remote
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it is no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you will be supported to learn, grow, and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

As the US Marketing Manager for Foley Alternatives, you will own the fastest growing portfolio in Acute Care and one of the fastest growing platforms within BD. This individual will work cross functionally to develop and execute commercial strategies to achieve business unit objectives. The visibility of this position demands strong leadership, adaptability, and a growth mindset.

The role encompasses diverse responsibilities including but not limited to launch execution, creation and deployment of strategic marketing programs, field sales support, value proposition development, omnichannel marketing campaigns, and evidence generation. These efforts require a strong commercial acumen that centers on driving growth and achieving financial targets. Reporting directly to the Senior Marketing Manager, the Marketing Manager will drive growth and own the commercial strategy for the platform.

Responsibilities:

  • Own the general management for the Foley Alternative portfolio which includes the PureWickTM franchise, intermittent catheters, and MECs, focused on US commercial strategy, financial performance, demand and supply planning, budget management, and sales engagement.

  • Conduct regular customer visits to develop awareness of key market requirements, identify unmet needs and support the sales organization.

  • Gather and maintain quantitative market knowledge (e.g., market data, market trends, competitive pricing) and qualitative market data (e.g., customer needs, competitor activities, plans, technologies, and applications).

  • Responsible for consistently meeting or exceeding financial goals and performance metrics.

  • Cultivate connections with influential key opinion leaders and customers to promote market engagement through educational events.

  • Devise and execute bold marketing plans to drive product growth and market penetration including collateral, value propositions, competitive messaging, pricing strategies, and lifecycle management initiatives.

  • Create and implement focused omnichannel campaigns for the Foley Alternative portfolio, aligning with key sales initiatives in target accounts.

  • Develop and support voice of customer activities to drive innovation and product optimization.

  • Effectively collaborate with other functions such as R&D, Customer Service, Sales, Medical Affairs, Regulatory, Quality, Operations, and Training.

  • Identify evidence generation requirements that will support ongoing business momentum in response to changing market dynamics.

  • Develop and execute strategic marketing programs that drive business growth by embracing innovative perspectives and implementing essential changes.

  • Adhere to all company policies, procedures, and business ethics codes and ensures they are communicated and implemented within the team.

Qualifications:

Experience and Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, or science required, MBA preferred.

  • 3-5+ years of relevant marketing and/or commercial experience in life sciences, biotechnology, or other healthcare field with a consistent track-record of high performance and results.

  • Experience leading teams and working cross-functionally is preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Strategic thinker with demonstrated ability to formulate and implement bold marketing and product strategies, convert these into tactical marketing plans, and deliver results.

  • Creative out-of-the-box mindset, is intellectually curious, stays current on new trends, and takes calculated risks with novel ideas.

  • Sound decision making capabilities and the ability to make decisions in uncertain or risky situations, even in the absence of consensus, when necessary.

  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to develop strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

  • Strong leadership presence with the ability to utilize organizational channels, experience and influencing skills to effectively negotiate and persuade others.

  • Excellent organization skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment of competing priorities. Ability to routinely work on multiple tasks with multiple people while effectively prioritizing.

  • Excellent presentation and communication skills for a wide variety of audiences.

  • Courage to speak up when important information or questions must be raised and takes action when issues must be addressed.

  • Flexibility to travel 30% of the time.

In some locations, testing for COVID-19 may be available and/or required. Job Description Summary

Be part of something bigger!
Liberator Medical Supply™ (LMS) has been serving urology and ostomy customers for more than two decades. LMS is dedicated to providing high-quality, innovative medical supplies combined with exemplary customer service, discreet delivery of supplies and support with insurance paperwork and representation.
We have an immediate need for QA Chart Approval Representatives!

In this role you will review patient medical supply documentation currently or previously obtained by the Sales Support team to ensure that the documents meet the compliance standards of Liberator Medical Supply and of the industry.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

Job Title: US Marketing Manager, Urological Drainage - Hybrid
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it is no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you will be supported to learn, grow, and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

As the US Marketing Manager , you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing the strategic direction for our Urological Drainage portfolio . This role places significant emphasis on expanding market share through key marketing initiatives to achieve our business objectives. The visibility of this position demands strong leadership, adaptability, and a growth mindset.

The role encompasses diverse responsibilities including but not limited to launch execution, creation and deployment of strategic marketing programs, field sales support, value proposition development, omnichannel marketing campaigns, and evidence generation. These efforts require a strong commercial acumen that centers on driving growth and achieving financial targets. Reporting directly to the Senior Marketing Manager, the Marketing Manager will be a leader for the platform, working closely with cross functional teams to develop and execute commercial strategies.

Responsibilities:

  • Own the general management for the Urological Drainage portfolio, which includes the Foley catheters, Foley Care, and StatLockTM franchises, focused on US commercial strategy, financial performance, demand and supply planning, budget management, and sales engagement.

  • Conduct regular customer visits to develop awareness of key market requirements, identify unmet needs and support the sales organization.

  • Gather and maintain quantitative market knowledge (e.g., market data, market trends, competitive pricing) and qualitative market data (e.g., customer needs, competitor activities, plans, technologies, and applications).

  • Responsible for consistently meeting or exceeding financial goals and performance metrics.

  • Cultivate connections with influential key opinion leaders and customers to promote market engagement through educational events.

  • Devise and execute bold marketing plans to drive product growth and market penetration including collateral, value propositions, competitive messaging, pricing strategies, and lifecycle management initiatives.

  • Create and implement focused omnichannel campaigns for the Urological Drainage portfolio, aligning with key sales initiatives in target accounts.

  • Develop and support voice of customer activities to drive innovation and product optimization.

  • Effectively collaborate with other functions such as R&D, Customer Service, Sales, Medical Affairs, Regulatory, Quality, Operations, and Training.

  • Identify evidence generation requirements that will support ongoing business momentum in response to changing market dynamics.

  • Develop and execute strategic marketing programs that drive business growth by embracing innovative perspectives and implementing essential changes.

  • Adhere to all company policies, procedures, and business ethics codes and ensures they are communicated and implemented within the team.

Qualifications:

Experience and Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business required, MBA preferred.

  • 3-5+ years of relevant marketing and/or commercial experience in life sciences, biotechnology, or other healthcare field with a consistent track-record of high performance and results.

  • Experience managing and leading teams and working cross-functionally is preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Strategic thinker with demonstrated ability to formulate and implement bold marketing and product strategies, convert these into tactical marketing plans, and deliver results.

  • Creative out-of-the-box mindset, is intellectually curious, stays current on new trends, and takes calculated risks with novel ideas. Demonstrated ability to redirect a commercial strategy or deliver a “turnaround” in business performance is strongly desired.

  • Sound decision making capabilities and the ability to make decisions in uncertain or risky situations, even in the absence of consensus, when necessary.

  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to develop strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

  • Strong leadership presence with the ability to utilize organizational channels, experience and influencing skills to effectively negotiate and persuade others.

  • Excellent organization skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment of competing priorities. Ability to routinely work on multiple tasks with multiple people while effectively prioritizing.

  • Excellent presentation and communication skills for a wide variety of audiences.

  • Courage to speak up when important information or questions must be raised and takes action when issues must be addressed.

  • Flexibility to travel 30% of the time.

Job Title: Marketing Manager, BD Port Access and BD HD Check (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

For the US Region within the Medication Delivery Solutions business unit, this role will lead marketing for the BD Port Access portfolio of products as well as the BD HD Check System. The individual will provide significant input into product line-related business decisions; play a critical role in key projects/initiatives, often leading project/initiative teams. Demonstrating marketing expertise through specific and advanced set of skills and knowledge, e.g. branding, product development, forecasting is required.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Overview:

For the US Region within the Medication Delivery Solutions business unit, this role will lead marketing for the BD Port Access portfolio of products as well as the BD HD Check System. The individual will provide significant input into product line-related business decisions; play a critical role in key projects/initiatives, often leading project teams.  Demonstrating marketing expertise through specific and set of skills and knowledge, e.g. branding, product development, forecasting is required.

Responsibilities:

  • Develops marketing strategies and implement marketing plans for assigned products to ensure the achievement of financial/budget expectations and product line strategies, including market sensing, market development and marketing mix.

  • Establishes and maintains relationships with US based key opinion leaders, prioritized associations and medical societies as required to stay updated on current and emerging trends in clinical practices, market, and competitive trends.

  • US Region Tracking, monitoring, and reporting in a cohesive and articulate manner account wins, losses & pricing adjustments -- and synthesis of opportunities and risks.

  • Leads drivers of demand for assigned product line(s) such as pricing strategy, channel strategy, contracting, and product mix.

  • Collaborates with Sales Leadership to provide direction on supply allocation strategy when needed.

  • Trade show and convention planning, strategy development and coordination.

  • Works with customer facing functions including, but not limited to, Oncology and Vascular Care Sales, Customer Service, Directors of National Accounts, Channel Management and aligns with, and where required establishes relationships with GPOs, Distributors, Territory Managers and other pertinent customers and partners to drive growth.

  • Supports training for new hires and refresher training courses as required by Sales Development.

  • Acts as the Marketing Core Team Member for new product launches and product / business development opportunities as appropriate

  • Prepare budgets, forecasts, projections, and necessary reports complete and on time to the relevant personnel.

  • Develop, and apply market analyses and market research where vital, and evaluate results to optimize the marketing planning process.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree, MBA preferred

  • Minimum of 3 years of business experience in the healthcare industry

  • Minimum of 2 years in product, market management or sales.

  • Experience in identifying Market Opportunities, Market Segmentation, Targeted Marketing, Customer Insight Gathering, Competitive Analysis, Pricing Strategy and Go to Market models and strategies

  • Ability to travel 10% of the time

Job Description Summary

Overview:
The Senior Marketing Manager, ID/AST™ is responsible for driving profitable growth of BD ID/AST portfolio and by driving the execution of the BD Integrated Microbiology Solution. This highly strategic portfolio will continue to be a growth engine for BD Diagnostic Solutions over the coming years and to ensure success, this role requires the development of comprehensive commercial marketing strategies and execution of tactical marketing plans and programs. The position will require tight collaboration across multiple stakeholders within the US and Global platforms—including commercial marketing, sales, and service resources to ensure that short and long-term growth objectives for US Integrated Diagnostic Solutions are achieved.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads the definition and development of commercial and product marketing strategies and collaborates with the Commercial Marketing team on the execution to achieve the business objectives.

  • Oversee messaging and development of literature associated with the BD Phoenix™ brand.

  • Identify clinical tools for health care professionals for the utilization of BD ID/AST solutions in partnership with the Clinical, Medical Affairs and Professional Services team.

  • Coordinate with Global Marketing and Product Development in launching new products associated with the portfolio.

  • Informs the demand planning process in partnership with Marketing Operations team; represents portfolio at Demand Consensus and S&OP meetings.

  • Manages the annual financial planning cycles (budget, forecasts, and ASR) for the portfolio.

  • Initiates key marketing initiatives directed to all target customer segments: NRLs and Hospital Labs

  • Partners with integrated Marketing Communication team to create and execute omni-channel marketing programs in alignment with branding strategy.

  • Launches products; develops strategies, tactics and training plans for the Customer Service organization, Applications and Sales teams.

  • Builds and implements pricing strategies, market analysis, promotional programs, market research requirements and channel strategies.

  • Provides marketing and support at conferences, users’ meetings, customer sites, end user workshops, and other specific marketing events.

  • Develops KOL group and speaker opportunities, coordinates webinars, as appropriate.

​ Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Business, Life Sciences, or a closely related field. MBA highly desirable.

  • 5 years of relevant Marketing and Sales experience in medical device and/or commercial laboratory industry is required.

  • 5 years of Product Marketing Management and Commercial (Sales, Marketing, Service) experience is required.

  • Flexibility to travel up to 35% of the time.

  • Develop and implement commercial strategies, and convert these into tactical marketing plans, delivering results.

  • Strong business acumen and knowledge of clinical and/or laboratory market environment.

  • Sound decision making capabilities and the ability to make decisions, even in absence of consensus when necessary.

  • Creative out-of-the-box problem solver who is intellectually curious, stays current on new trends, and takes calculated risks with novel ideas.

  • Excellent presentation and communication skills for a wide variety of audiences.

  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to develop strong relationships with key opinion leaders, customers, advisory boards, and potential or existing business partners.

  • Strong leadership skills with an ability to set a vision, lead change and to motivate others.

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment of competing priorities. Ability to routinely work on multiple tasks with multiple people while effectively prioritizing.

Job Description Summary

Field Service Engineer 2
The Field Service Engineer 2 for BD Pyxis Dispensing Devices is accountable for independently providing efficient and effective field service support to all BD dispensing customers within a given territory in a timely manner, including, but not limited to service and repair, preventative maintenance, calibration, installations, and limited cross-functional support for Sales and Implementation teams.

Job Description

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

The BD family is seeking responsible and committed people to join our team of professional Field Service Engineers for the support of the BD Medication Management solutions (MMS) automated dispensing segment. The BD Pyxis brand combines proven technology with actionable intelligence to prevent medication errors, help free up clinician time to focus on patient care, increase the predictability of medication availability and reduce inefficiencies in the medication use process. At almost every point in the medication use process, safety and efficiency can be increased with the comprehensive capabilities of the Pyxis medication management system. Learn more at:
https://www.bd.com/en-us/offerings/capabilities/medication-and-supply-management/medication-and-supply-management-technologies


Our goal is to deliver an excellent service experience so interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills are a must. Additionally, the Field Service Engineer is responsible for collaborating with cross-functional teams within our Global Customer Support organization to understand and be sensitive to our customer and business needs from end to end.


With more than a century of experience and our global reach, BD leads in patient and healthcare worker safety and the technologies that enable medical research and clinical laboratories.

The Field Service Engineer is a remote field-based position with daily travel to our customer locations within the assigned territory. Ideal candidates will reside within a 30-mile radius of where the position is based. Company vehicle provided. 5% overnight travel possible and a valid driver’s license is required.


Accountabilities:

  • They will provide remote and on-site technical support for BD Pyxis automated dispensing systems located within hospitals and other healthcare facilities within the region and in accordance with our customer support agreements

  • Respond to, evaluate, and prioritize work orders; diagnose, service, and resolve issues regarding proprietary hardware and software system components, retain ownership of the work order, increase issues to the team lead and manager; log, track, and document all work order activity, and be capable of fully supporting all products within the region

  • Implement a preventive maintenance program, provide limited cross-functional support for our Sales and Implementation teams, and other support activities as applicable to the role

  • Demonstrate a sufficient use of competency and a superior ability to troubleshoot hardware and software problems

  • Provide efficient field services to all BD customers in a timely manner, including but not limited to installations, in-servicing, repair, preventive maintenance, calibration, and sales support

  • Maintain proper and accurate small parts inventory for the purpose of service and follow approved policies and procedures for inventory controls

  • Provide accurate and timely documentation that details field activity, expenses, time distribution and other information as required

  • Continue training and self-development to learn the products and applications of the company for success in the role, advance skills, and attend management approved seminars and training sessions to advance to the next level in 3-5 years

  • Maintain company assets (car, tools, and inventories) securely and in working order

  • Possess and maintain a superior knowledge of corporate and service department procedures and policies, including customer complaint handling and Medical Device Reporting

  • Able to work independently and also in a team environment, and engage/raise to team leadership for sophisticated solving and resolution of issues as needed.

Qualifications for the BD Pyxis Field Service role:

  • Associate Degree in Healthcare Technology preferred or 3-5 years of related work experience of combination Hardware/Software/IT experience

  • 24x7 on-call experience in a customer-facing/field service environment, required

  • Good mechanical, computer, verbal, written, and time management skills, required

  • Computer electronics, Windows OS, network experience, required

  • CompTIA A+ Certification, required

  • Medical device or electromechanical device service/repair experience, required

  • Customer Support Certification, required

  • Prior experience working as a hospital pharmacy technician or in a hospital Bio-Med environment, a plus

  • Prior customer support center experience/training, a plus

  • Prior military Bio-Med experience, a plus

  • Prior Automated Teller Machine (ATM) experience, a plus

  • Must be able to work within defined processes and methodologies with minimal degree of supervision

  • Must possess and maintain a valid driver's license and meet BD's auto safety standards.

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to lift 30 to 40 lb. objects from the floor to chest level
  • Ability to turn manual sockets, crescent wrenches, and screw drivers repeatedly over the course of an 8-to-10-hour day
  • Ability to sit, kneel, squat, bend, and stand repeatedly in a 8–10-hour period to assemble and repair instrument suites
  • Ability to push and pull objects weighing up to 70 lbs
  • Ability to perform fine motor tasks while reaching over the course of an 8–10-hour day
  • Ability to carry a 30 lb. pack on your back for up to 1 hour
  • Ability to drive distances of up to 6 hours, and in adverse weather conditions
  • Able to climb portable ladders and step stools

  • Upon hire, must provide proof of and maintain current immunizations and obtain additional immunizations appropriate for the facility which enables access to customer sites in order to perform essential job functions. Proofs must include: Hepatitis B, Influenza (current year), MMR (mumps, measles, rubella), Varicella (chicken pox) Annual TB/PPD (skin test), Tetanus/Diphtheria/Pertussis, COVID-19.

Job Title: National Customer Success Executive (Field Based- Western United States)
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

The Customer Success Executive (CSE) will be responsible for ensuring the overall success and value delivery of our Medication Management Solutions (MMS) at our largest and most strategic customers. This role orchestrates cross-functional programs and resources that deliver customer value and satisfaction and enables transformational customer outcomes. By developing meaningful relationships with C-Suite executives and functional leaders, this role serves as a trusted advisor and partner to our customers. The CSE will successfully promote long-term adoption of MMS technologies by helping the customer optimize the utilization of the solutions they purchase and demonstrate realized returns on investment.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Broad Scope & Purpose:

The Customer Success Executive (CSE) will be responsible for ensuring the overall success and value delivery of our Medication Management Solutions at our largest and most strategic customers. This role orchestrates cross-functional programs and resources that deliver customer value and satisfaction and enables transformational customer outcomes. By developing meaningful relationships with C-Suite executives and functional leaders, this role serves as a trusted advisor and partner to our customers.  The CSE will successfully promote long-term adoption of MMS technologies by helping the customer optimize the utilization of the solutions they purchase and demonstrate realized returns on investment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Establish a trusted/strategic advisor relationship with Pharmacy, Nursing, IT, and Procurement leadership.

  • Partner with our customers for the entire sales life cycle; identify strategies to drive customer success, including process and data improvement initiatives to promote adoption, optimization, and customer retention.

  • Tracking and ensuring utilization of all contractual entitlements annually, such as SMS, ISMS, Trifecta, HealthSight, and Interop/IT Assessment

  • Ensuring software upgrades are current (not more than one version behind) and that key strategic documents are established and updated, including current state device and IT diagram, upgrade roadmap, customer value proposition and follow-up value confirmation, engagement with GCS initiated, internal documents and education plan completed.

  • Responsible for remediation planning, when applicable, including customer-facing contact, GCS alignment and engagement, and accountability for ensuring successful completion and a positive customer experience

  • MMS point of contact for customer feedback, support, concerns, or questions, providing a warm handoff to responsible parties, as applicable. This also includes monitoring PM compliance and TSC case monitoring and escalation.

  • Developing Vice President and Director level relationships at assigned IDNs, performing bi-annual roadmap and business review meetings and engaging BD’s key account leadership (GCS, Marketing, Sales, others as appropriate)

  • Increase overall customer Net Promoter Scores (NPS) across assigned health systems.

  • Promote and drive an ease of doing business to ensure growth and continued partnership.

Skills and Competencies:

  • Excellent customer interaction skills

  • Ability to effectively manage executives at all levels

  • Familiarity working with clients of all sizes.

  • Advanced negotiation and conflict resolution skills

  • Shown ability to drive continuous value of product(s).

  • Impeccable written and verbal communication skills.

  • Detail oriented and analytical.

  • Strong team player but still a self-starter, no one needs to push you to excel

  • Thrives in a multi-tasking environment and can adjust priorities on-the-fly.

  • Eager to learn, adapt and perfect your work; you seek out help and put it to good use.

  • Ability to influence without authority and operate effectively in ambiguous situations

Experience and Education:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent

  • 8-10 years’ experience in Customer Success or equivalent history of increasing customer satisfaction, adoption, and retention required in a large-scale business.

  • Sales or post-sales experience strongly preferred

  • Demonstrated understanding of hospital systems’ operations and decision making strongly preferred

  • Proficient in Office software

  • Experience with Salesforce or other Force.com platforms strongly preferred

  • Prior experience in selling value added services at the executive level a plus

  • Must maintain a valid driver's license and meet BD's auto safety standards

  • Ability to travel over 50%

  • Position is Field -Based, within the Western United States

Job Title: Associate Director, MDS US Oncology Care Marketing
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Summary :

As Associate Director, MDS US Region, you will l ead marketing for the BD Oncology Care product lines in the US Region within the Medication Delivery Solutions business unit.  Your responsibility will span the Hazardous Drug Solutions and Port Access businesses.  You will a play a critical role in leading downstream, regional marketing efforts including the annual strategic review, marketing planning, financial budgeting and Sales support to drive growth.  This role has responsibility for directly leading a marketing manager associate and requires marketing expertise in advanced set of skills and knowledge, e.g. branding, product launch, commercial execution.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Utilizes the BD Way of Marketing methodology, competencies, and tools to evaluate US competitive marketing strategy and moves to renew/refine strategy including go-to-market elements to accelerate growth and product category share gain and achieve and exceed growth expectations in dollars, units, and gross profitability targets.

  • Develops and manages all aspects of annual strategic review (ASR) and marketing plans for assigned products to ensure the achievement of financial/budget expectations and product line strategies, including market sensing, market development and marketing mix.

  • Works with customer facing functions including, but not limited to, Oncology and Vascular Care Sales, Customer Service, Directors of National Accounts, Channel Management and aligns with, and where required establishes relationships with GPOs, Distributors, and other pertinent customers and partners to drive growth.

  • Establishes and maintains relationships with US based thought leaders, key opinion leaders, prioritized associations and medical societies as required to stay updated on current and emerging trends in clinical practices, market, and competitive trends.

  • US Region Tracking, monitoring, and reporting in a cohesive and articulate manner account wins, losses & pricing adjustments -- and synthesis of opportunities and risks. The Associate Director will be required to provide regular reports to Management and provide input to budget, projections, and forecasts.

  • Participates as a Marketing Core Team Member on cross-platform teams initiatives, delivering the marketing leadership and support needed to the relevant projects.  Works constructively with internal functions including Regulatory Affairs, Medical Affairs, Quality, Finance and leadership.

  • Ensure that all activities are consistent with the BD core values and comply with relevant acts, legal demands, and regulatory and ethical standards.

  • Develop, and utilize market analyses and market research where necessary, and evaluate results to optimize the marketing planning process.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Minimum 6 years of marketing experience required.

  • Minimum bachelor’s degree, MBA preferred.

  • Life Science Industry experience required.

  • Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills required, PowerBI and Salesforce preferred.

  • BD Way of Marketing experience is preferred.

  • Strong cross-collaboration skills and proven experience working with customers and sales.

Job Description Summary

The US Region at BD aims to be the preferred partner that delivers differentiated value and addresses our customers’ needs in an evolving, dynamic healthcare market.

The mission of the Commercial & Customer Operations (CCO) Center of Excellence (CoE) is to serve as a trusted strategic partner that enables the US Region and business units to drive profitable commercial growth by delivering differentiated value, enabling capabilities, and simplified processes that exceed the needs of our stakeholders and improve customer experience. CCO aims to empower and develop our associates while strengthening our inclusive & diverse culture to win as ‘One BD’.

The CCO organization operates across the entire US Region, partnering with the business units to provide and develop enabling capabilities in the areas of commercial contracting, sales enablement and operations, customer care operations, business & pricing analytics, master data management, commercial enablement, operational excellence, and other functions. We aim to strengthen our foundational capabilities and deliver customer value through simplification and improvement initiatives, develop and prepare our associates, build an inclusive culture, drive digital transformation, and expand our strategic capabilities while remaining agile to the evolving needs of our customers. We currently have an open position for Contract Consultant, GPO Offer Development.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is o ur Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Reporting to the Manager, GPO Contract Offer Development, this position facilitates the contracting lifecycle process for BD GPO agreements across multiple US Business Segments for both consumable and capital products.

As a member of the GPO Contract Offer Development team, the Contract Consultant will contribute to the formalized process of a contracting capability within the CoE delivering contract development standard processes. Through partnership and collaboration within Commercial and Customer Operations, the Strategic Customer Group sales team, Commercial Integrators, cross functional Business Partners and Legal, this role supports US Region policies, processes, and governance of GPO contracts to ensure the effective implementation of critical contract activities.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Assist with all phases of BD National, Regional and aggregation group GPO contracts lifecycle including planning, bid submission, execution, amendment, extension, and retirement.

  • Work with the SCVP-GPO, Manager and Business Units to ensure contract terms are negotiated in accordance with established BD standard T&C policies and procedures, as well as legal and regulatory requirements. Weighs contract risk to the businesses and provides solutions for successful contract awards.

  • Responsible for meeting financial impacting bid submission deadlines.

  • Provides direction to appropriate Commercial and Customer Operations teams for successful contract implementation and life cycle management.

  • Leads or participates in contract implementation meetings, GPO team calls, and other meetings as required.

  • Advises Contract Operations in order to facilitate prompt responses to GPO contract issues, such as pricing and membership questions.

  • Triage GPO related issues for various Business Units and field teams, providing critical input, analysis, and conflict resolution guidance.

  • Subject matter expert for all daily business questions from internal partners.

  • Provide high levels of responsiveness, timeliness, and accuracy in contract dispute resolutions.

  • Maintain strategic contract information in CLM tool and SharePoint site, providing accurate executable information across the organization.

  • Other duties as assigned, including but not limited to, providing cross coverage to other areas of GPO Offer Development.

  • Takes personal accountability for one’s own decisions, elevates risk as appropriate.

Education

  • BA/BS required (in lieu of a bachelor’s degree, 5+ years of experience in the applicable area)

Skills

  • Strong problem solver with business insight.

  • Proven ability to quickly establish credibility, trust, and support within all levels of organization.

  • Effective communicator and a self-motivated teammate capable of working in a fast-paced work environment.

  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel required.

  • Ability to travel: 5%.

Key Competencies

  • Problem-Solving Orientation

    • Organizational Agility

  • Delivering Under Pressure

  • Striving for Continuous Improvement

  • Customer Focus

Job Title: Mngr, IBP and E2E Supply Chain Planning
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

The Manger, IBP and E2E Supply Chain Planning, will drive IBP transformation and expand the process throughout the business unit’s product platforms across all regions and plants. This position encompasses an enterprise wide focus to deliver the Demand Plan and Supply Plan leading to the successful delivery of the business unit’s financial performance through the 5 Step IBP Process of Portfolio Management Review, Demand Review, Supply Review, Integrated Reconciliation, and the Management Business Review. The Manager’s responsibility will include supporting and driving continuous improvement initiatives throughout the end-to-end supply chain that enables capacity, optimizes inventory, delivers customer service and revenue. The Manager, IBP and E2E Supply Chain Planning, will serve as Supply Chain Lead for specific Product Portfolio Platforms driving monthly demand reviews, monthly supply reviews, network optimization, product life cycle management, and all supply chain activities in support of the Product Portfolio. This role requires a natural leader and facilitator who is driven, analytical, critical thinker, detail and action oriented, organized, and enjoys developing business processes. The Manger will drive a culture of change and continuous improvement through performance measures, collaboration, and feedback throughout the Supply Chain Process. The Manager will collaborate with cross functional partners to drive continuous improvement, organizational standards, and best practices supporting each IBP Process Step.

Job Description

This role will be Remote

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Responsibilities

  • Drive the implementation of the IBP process across the organization through effective stakeholder management and change management techniques

  • Assist in preparing all data and presentations needed to support the monthly IBP process including portfolio review, global demand review (GDR), global supply review (GSR), integrated reconciliation (IR), and management business review (MBR)

  • Document assumptions with root cause analysis to quantify MoM changes related to demand, sales, and supply at regional and global level across all platforms to provide end-to-end visibility to drive action to mitigate risk

  • Manage the monthly planning cycle, facilitate decision making and alignment on monthly demand operational forecasts and monthly supply leading the delivery of options, risk scenarios  and recommendations to leadership to drive timely actions

  • Work collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders and business partners to develop, adopt, mature, and improve the IBP process, ensuring global standardization and best practice usage

  • Assists IBP lead in driving monthly actions that will resolve demand – supply challenges that deliver our operational forecast, sales, and yield inventory improvement measures which positively support the entire IBP process

  • Lead Supply Chain Activities in support of assigned Product Platform Portfolio

    • Analyze marketing, sales data, history, leveraging technology to generate an accurate statistical baseline forecast enriching by incorporating value added insight

    • Execute Demand Planning

    • Facilitates monthly demand forecast aggregation, including consensus between cross functional stakeholders and stakeholders

    • Perform Supply Planning Activities working with Operations Partners, Procurement, and Plants

    • Responsible for maintaining a 24 month rolling demand forecast properly reflecting sales plans and a 24-month rolling supply plan that meets the latest operational plan, showing all risks and opportunities.

    • Optimize Inventory

    • Ensure Revenue Commitment Delivery and Customer Service Commitments

    • Lead Product Lifecycle Management Initiatives

    • Ensure Master Data Accuracy and Error Resolution Process

  • Support key projects as needed

Collaboration

  • Collaborates with cross functional partners in Region, Planning, Operations, Procurement, Finance and Business to optimize the planning process throughout the Business Unit

  • Works collaboratively with cross functional partners to assist in delivering key projects in support of IBP which will minimize inventory investment, maximize customer growth opportunities, drive supply chain optimization, and drive financial commitments

  • Coordinates, facilitates, and documents scheduled planning meeting actions and output

Performance Tracking and Management

  • Measures controls, and improves IBP accuracy through clear, defined metrics

  • Presents and manages key performance metrics to provide root cause analysis and recommendations for performance improvement that represent a meaningful business impact analysis

Communication

  • Delivers Communication that is clear, direct, and fact based

  • Turns data into information to drive decision making and action

  • Assists with weekly, monthly leadership presentations – as needed

Innovation

  • Explores and Implements potential innovative opportunities:

    • Technical initiatives to automate data collection and improve data analysis

    • Performance management, reporting automation, and digitization leveraging technology to move away from manual xls spreadsheet process

    • Standardize metrics dashboard

Skills Required

  • Bachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, Logistics, or Operations
  • 7+ Years experience in Supply Chain (Forecasting, Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Inventory Planning, Materials Management, Master Planning, Scheduling, Lifecycle management)
  • Strong Working knowledge of S&OE, S&OP, and IBP with implementation experience
  • Experience with Statistical Forecasting Tools and Advanced Planning Systems Software
  • Action oriented, results driven with strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to influence key stakeholders, work independently, collaboratively, and effectively manage multiple projects at the same time
  • Ability to work independently, collaboratively, and effectively manage multiple projects at the same time
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications

Skills Preferred

  • Demonstrated experience working in Inventory optimization tools (ie: Kinaxis, Llamasoft) and ERP systems (i.e. JDE, SAP, etc.)
  • APICS and/or IBF certification
  • Proficient in Microsoft PowerBI and Microsoft SQL

Job Title: BD Alaris™ System Senior Marketing Manager – Hybrid
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Come join a great team leading the fast-paced infusion delivery and connectivity space at one of the largest medical device companies in the world.

We are looking for a creative, highly motivated marketer who can drive growth in BD Alaris™ connectivity and data platform for the US Region. We need a passionate marketer who can lead the Regional efforts in support of the products and organizational objectives, and deliver business results.

Do you like business strategy? Do you love uncovering reasons why people buy and working on cross-functional team? The marketer who will thrive in this role is comfortable in undefined spaces and doesn’t mind working at both a strategic and tactical level to influence the customer buying process and drive sales.

This role will be responsible for establishing and executing a strategic direction for fast-growing connectivity and data solutions for BD Alaris™ Infusion System franchise. This person will drive business growth as measured by customer adoption, competitive conversions, sales revenue, profitability, and customer satisfaction. He/she will be responsible for developing key insights into market opportunities, creating solutions to commercial barriers, shaping the market, and executing strategies to drive financial performance.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Key responsibilities will include:

In this role you will have deep working knowledge of the BD Alaris™ System and data platform. Core job responsibilities include:

  • Marketing programs and communications

    • Continuously invest in understanding customer pain points and their strategic objectives and create relevant marketing campaigns and initiatives.

    • Define and execute marketing programs required for demand generation and customer acquisition and retention to support revenue and sales objectives.

    • Develop integrated marketing campaign strategies for assigned product portfolio and coordinate their execution.

    • Identify opportunities to develop support tools/processes that increase sales productivity and effectiveness in the field.

    • Market intelligence – understand and effectively convey the competitive landscape; create competitive strategies, tools, and messaging.

    • Support RFP/RFI content development, demonstrations at tradeshow and safety center activities

  • Go-to-market (GTM)/Product Launches

    • Plan and coordinate the execution of new product launch plans.

    • Define commercialization goals, objectives and success criteria and metrics.

    • Define market segments, personas and differentiating value offer/positioning and messaging.

    • Represent US Region launch readiness in Commercial Excellence Reviews, Portfolio Development Teams, and Marketing Functional meetings.

    • Collaborate with internal teams to ensure that operational requirements are met prior to launch.

  • Marketing Planning and implementation

    • Support the annual marketing planning and Annual Strategic Planning processes for assigned product portfolio; coordinate the development and execution of marketing plans, including where to play and how to win.

    • Monitor and report on effectiveness of marketing strategy execution, by leading the development and tracking relevant metrics and performance indicators.

    • Drive the initiation, planning, deployment, and execution of key projects and programs to ensure the timely completion of marketing deliverables towards the achievement of established marketing strategies.

    • Coordinate development and deployment of HEOR evidence generation activities and customer material to highlight successes and best practices, including testimonials, case studies, videos, and webinars etc.

  • Financial and Pricing Strategy:

    • Support annual business planning process for your portfolio, including both strategic and tactical financial budgeting.

    • Develop pricing programs and optimal pricing strategies appropriate customer segments.

About you: To be successful in this role, you will possess :

  • A drive for execution, an ability to work independently and maintain focus on key business drivers.

  • An ability to Influence others: demonstrate strong persuasion and timing skills.

  • An ability to work effectively and collaboratively in a matrix environment.

  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills and the ability to reinforce this behavior in matrix interactions.

  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and persuasion skills

Experience and Education

  • Minimum bachelor’s degree in science or related field such as marketing or business; MBA or advanced degree a strong plus.

  • Minimum 5 years of marketing and/or commercial experience in medical technology, diagnostics, life sciences, or other healthcare field with a consistent track-record of high performance and results.

  • Strong business and financial acumen are desired.

  • Experience in planning, executing, and measuring marketing programs strongly preferred, background in and knowledge of connectivity and informatics is preferred.

  • Experience working cross-functionally in a matrixed organization is preferred.

Job Description Summary

As Contract Consultant, Government, you will work closely with internal business unit partners and Federal Government customers on all stages of the government contracting lifecycle. Contract Consultants demonstrate a solid understanding of government contracting process and compliance.  You will be responsible for proactively setting priorities for teams to ensure task completion while coordinating work activities with other team members.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

As Contract Consultant, Government, you will work closely with internal business unit partners and Federal Government customers on all stages of the government contracting lifecycle. Contract Consultants demonstrate a solid understanding of government contracting process and compliance.  You will be responsible for proactively setting priorities for teams to ensure task completion while coordinating work activities with other team members.

Key Responsibilities

Business Opportunities and Strategy

  • Monitor government and third-party outlets such as SAM.gov for opportunities that align with the BDX product portfolio.

  • Completing tasks in support of solicitation process with responsibility for opportunity identification, solicitation review, internal team meetings

  • Work alongside business unit SMEs, customers, and sales to produce solicitation responses that are accurate and compliant

  • Develop solicitation project plans to handling tasks and deadlines with internal partners, including escalating issues in a timely manner, and communicate project status to management

  • Responsible for ongoing management and tracking of the solicitation process from identification of contract opportunity to award

Contract Management

  • Responsible for thorough and accurate review of all government contract awards.

  • Oversee the lifecycle of federal government contracts, from the solicitation phase to contract closeout.

  • Responsible for contract extension and closeout procedures; assist with analysis based on business needs.

  • Review and process any standard modifications (Product Add/Delete, Price Increase/Decrease, Customer Add/Delete, Administrative Changes), mass modifications, contract extensions, and/or contract closeout requests from customers; Engage SMEs as applicable

  • Identify, create, monitor, and update contractual obligations within CLM and communicate obligations to internal partners when applicable to ensure future requirements are completed as agreed upon within the award

  • Coordinate with functional business partners to ensure all post award activities are completed and prepared for start of award

  • Develop data requirements for reporting when required to include sales reporting and other contract reporting requirements

Compliance and Risk Assessment

  • Review FAR and other government clauses

  • Assist with Government audit activities

  • Maintain compliance with BD document retention policy in CLM

  • Ensure that contractual obligations are met adequately and on time; engaging internal SMEs as needed

Requirements

  • Minimum BA/BS required with 3 years of government or corporate experience, or without Bachelor degree, 5+ years extensive experience in the applicable area preferred

  • Confirmed experience in contract management

  • Keen contract interpretation with the ability to assess requirements and collect information to compliantly satisfy contractual obligations

  • Demonstrated matrix management skills; ability to handle tasks across various teams to meet obligation due dates

  • Consistent record to quickly establish credibility, trust, and support across the organization

  • Strong customer-centric skills

  • Strong communication; must have the ability to execute in an everchanging environment

  • A high level of comfort with Excel

Preferred Skills

  • Experience handling Government contracts

  • Experience handling contracts through the contract lifecycle

  • SalesForce.com experience

  • Power BI experience preferred

  • Strong Excel Skills (V lookups, pivot tables, etc)

  • Experience with FAR, DFARS, and/or VAARs clause reviews

  • Experience with federal solicitations

Job Description Summary
The Procedural Specialist promotes BD products to customers and potential customers through clinical support and education within a defined geographic area and as directed by the Regional Manager.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self.

Responsibilities:

  • Promote BD Peripheral Intervention products to customers and potential customers through support and education within a defined geographic area and as determined by the Regional Manager.

  • Educate and train physicians, hospital personnel and hospital staff on technical matters relating to BD Peripheral Intervention products through case support, conducting and/or coordinating one-on-one in-servicing, and/or available internal/external physician education training programs.

  • Establishes and manages relationships with customers, hospitals and physicians. Acquires new users and applications for company products and services.

  • Observes and reports market trends which affect BD Peripheral Intervention sales, service and product development.

  • Represents BD Peripheral Intervention in accordance with policies and procedures.

  • Processes customer complaints and returns in accordance with established procedures and policy.

  • Maintains company automobile and company property.

  • Complete and processes BD Peripheral Intervention reports including but not limited to: Clinical Specialists reports, expense reports, monthly product tracking reports and complaint reports in accordance with established procedures and policies.

  • Fulfills the duty of a Territory Manager in vacant territories and supports endovascular procedures as directed by the District Manager.

Qualifications:

  • Associates Degree or B.S. in Nursing, Cardiovascular, Radiology, Vascular Surgery or other equivalent technical field.

  • Minimum of 3 - 5 years’ experience in the Operating Room, Interventional Radiology Lab, or Cardiac Cath Lab.

  • Current credentialing and / or certification in respective clinical field.

  • Sophisticated knowledge of vascular access management, vascular surgery, and endovascular medicine preferred.

  • Strong time management skills with an ability to maintain numerous priorities and meet established deadlines.

  • Self-motivated, takes on additional responsibilities, and balances priorities with minimal direction.

  • Frequent travel required.

  • Must possess and maintain a valid state-issued driver's license and meet BD's auto safety standards.

  • Product knowledge and all features and benefits of BD Peripheral Intervention products

  • Surgical and endovascular procedure knowledge, adequate to support clinical cases

  • Basic anatomy

  • Medical and surgical terminology
