Job Description Summary

As part of the overall growth strategy of BD’s Medication Delivery Solutions (MDS) business unit, this key marketing role focuses on the Catheter Care platform - one of the largest businesses within MDS. The role is accountable for the achievement of strategic marketing objectives including, but not limited to, acting as a marketing lead for key initiatives to increase gross profit and capture value, driving growth of the business through upgrading clinical practice, being a liaison to regional marketing counterparts and meeting/exceeding global business targets for the Catheter Care platform. This role influences the development and drives the execution of global and regional Catheter Care marketing plans. This role provides input into product line-related business decisions and resource planning.  Demonstrates marketing expertise through specific and advanced set of skills and knowledge. Contributes to the definition and refinement of global product planning and strategy.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Acts as the marketing core team lead on key cross-functional projects to maximize gross profit, increase penetration, and optimize our competitive and Go To Market approaches and efforts

  • Acts as a global marketing lead for key regions, ensuring achievement of business targets and facilitating market development efforts within regions

  • Responsible for Demand Governance across the platform to ensure consistent supply and capacity planning.  Serves as key liaison with all regions to proactively identify and resolve potential supply issues to deliver outstanding customer service

  • Identifies key growth opportunities globally through close collaboration with regions to update and analyze data regarding market, competitive, and business trends

  • Leads tender contract management in key regions which involves working with country and regional teams to manage customer offers and negotiations and ensure they align with Catheter Care’s strategy

  • Partners with global marketing team to develop educational tools, programs and training to drive solution selling and clinical practice upgrades from manual to pre-filled flush syringes.  Develops budget impact tools and case studies that help to drive clinical practice upgrades

  • Leads the development of a market assessment, business case and go to market strategies to enter the non-acute / home health care segment; a segment anticipated to drive significant incremental revenue growth in the next 5+ years for the Catheter Care Platform

Required knowledge and experience

  • Minimum of 3 years of business experience in the life science industry

  • Minimum of 3 years in product and/or market management

  • Business experience may include marketing, sales, sales training, business development

  • Minimum: bachelor’s degree, MBA highly preferred

  • Experience in Market Planning, Competitive Analysis, Pricing Strategy, Customer Insights/Analytics, Market Opportunity Assessment and Segmentation, and Go to Market and Commercialization strategies

  • Demonstrated strategic thinking and implementation skills; proven analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable marketing and business strategies and plans

  • Ability to develop comprehensive business cases with detailed financial analysis

  • Action oriented with demonstrated ability to drive results

  • Exhibits effective interpersonal communication skills, and can work internationally with diverse cultures.  Previous experience working with international teams is a plus

  • Strong organizational skills and demonstrated ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment of competing priorities

  • Ability to travel nationally and globally; 15-20%

Job Description Summary

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.

Becton, Dickinson Interventional (BDI) is a leading multinational developer, manufacturer and marketer of innovative, life-enhancing medical technologies in the fields of vascular, urology, oncology and surgical specialty products, employing over 65,000 people across 50 countries around the world. Founded more than 100 years ago, BDI pioneered many devices that are cornerstones of modern healthcare.
BD - PI is the vascular division within BDI and focusses on interventional products for peripheral arterial disease (PAD), end stage renal disease (ESRD), and Cancer.

Be Your Best at BD-PI – and ultimately, you can have an impact on the lives of people around the world.

Job Description Summary

This demand planner role will have primary responsibility for Supply Chain activities within the assigned Platforms and Product Lines to achieve business objectives, customer service goals and optimize inventory. The role will be responsible for forecasting, inputs to SIOP and IBP for the given product portfolios in alignment with market and financial requirements with the highest goal of increasing forecast accuracy. Successful candidate will demonstrate initiative and strong communication skills.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is o ur Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Essential / Key Job Responsibilities (including supervisory and/or fiscal):

  • Utilize analytical, marketing and sales data to effectively forecast global product requirements across a high mix portfolio

  • Lead the monthly demand SIOP reviews with the cross-functional business teams

  • Lead process improvement solutions to increase demand forecast accuracy

  • Monitor demand real-time highlighting variances from the forecast to proactively identify potential service issues and mitigate future customer impact

  • Develop and utilize complex spreadsheet analysis for statistical forecasting processes, scenario planning, issue resolution, and financial analyses

  • Lead the demand planning aspects for new product launches within assigned platform

  • Calculate stocking strategy requirements (ISS) for new product launches

  • Responsible for product phase-out planning, including actions to minimize inventory scrap

  • Partner with global supply planners to understand impacts to supply plans and proactively mitigate risk to customer service, inventory levels and cost

  • Responsible for SIOP and forecast accuracy reporting, including IBP report out

  • Partner with global supply planners to develop global inventory allocation strategies as needed, which may include production prioritization and global Regulatory build strategies

  • Provide input and approval for safety stock targets for assigned product portfolio. Includes understanding of calculation, proposals and maintenance of safety stock targets

  • Partner with inventory manager to understand impact of global demand changes on inventory as needed. May include estimated depletion and E&O risk

  • Provide input for SKU rationalization, RECODE, and other lifecycle management initiatives

  • Query databases for information required for decision-making

  • Provide insight and analyses to Business Unit leadership as needed in addition to supporting annual Business Planning process

  • Prepare Executive Level presentations as required

  • Ensure personal and company compliance with all Federal, State, local and company regulations, policies and procedures for Health, Safety and Environmental compliance

  • Other duties and projects, as assigned

Required Qualifications:

  • Must have strong experience and knowledge of demand/supply/production planning, forecasting techniques, inventory management, capacity leveling and logistics

  • Multi-year experience with planning systems, ERP systems experience required

  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills to resolve conflicts impacting the business strategy

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills including written, verbal, listening, and presentation

  • Strong interpersonal skills and proven record of strong teaming skills

  • Proven ability to successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously and effectively engage with multiple levels of management and cross-functional organizations (Marketing, Sales, Manufacturing, Engineering, Purchasing, Finance, Quality, etc.)

  • Advanced Excel skills to manipulate and analyze data

  • Demonstrated customer-centric focus and experience dealing with global markets a plus

  • Detail-oriented individual with a strong ability to multi-task

  • Demonstrated ability to be effective in a dynamic and energetic matrix organization with continuously changing program constraints

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Kinaxis/Rapid Response experience

  • Forecasting certification

  • Advanced knowledge of data visualization tools (Power BI, QlikView, Tableau, etc.)

  • Knowledge and awareness of Lean techniques and Six Sigma, experience

Education and/or Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, Logistics, Operations, or related degree; or MBA/MS in relevant discipline

  • 4+ years Supply Chain, planning and/or manufacturing experience

  • Demonstrated experience working in ERP systems (i.e. JDE, SAP, etc.)

  • APICS (CPIM, CSCP) or IBF (CPF, ACPF) certification desired, required within the first 3 years.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Procedural Specialist

Essential Job Functions:

  • Educate and train physicians, hospital personnel and hospital staff on technical matters relating to BDPI products through case support, conducting and/or coordinating one-on-one in-servicing, and/or available internal/external physician education training programs. Establishes and maintains relationships with customers, hospitals and physicians.

  • Obtains new users and applications for company products and services.

  • Observes and reports market trends which affect BDPI sales, service and product development.

  • Represents BDPI in accordance with policies and procedures.

  • Processes customer complaints and returns in accordance with established procedures and policy.

  • Maintains company automobile and company property.

  • Complete and processes BDPI reports including but not limited to: Procedural Specialist reports, expense reports, monthly product tracking reports and complaint reports in accordance with established procedures and policies.

  • Fulfills the duty of a Territory Manager in vacant territories and supports endovascular procedures as directed by the Regional Manager.

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Associates Degree or B.S. in Nursing, Cardiovascular, Radiology, Vascular Surgery or other equivalent technical discipline.

  • Minimum of 3 - 5 years experience in the Operating Room, Interventional Radiology Lab, or Cardiac Cath Lab.

  • Current credentialing and / or certification in respective clinical discipline. Advanced knowledge of vascular access management, vascular surgery, and endovascular medicine preferred.

  • Strong time management skills with an ability to maintain numerous priorities and meet established deadlines.

  • Self-motivated, takes on additional responsibilities, and manages priorities with minimal supervision.

  • Frequent travel required; up to 75%.

  • Must possess and maintain a valid state-issued driver's license and meet BD's auto safety standards.

Additional Qualifications, Skills, and Knowledge:

  • Surgical and endovascular procedure knowledge, adequate to support clinical cases

  • Basic anatomy Medical and surgical terminology

  • Product knowledge and all features and benefits of BDPI product preferred

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit and use hands to manipulate, handle or feel objects, tools, controls and office equipment. The employee frequently is required to talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel or crouch.

Work Environment:

While performing the duties of the job, the employee will be in various clinical settings including cath labs and operating rooms. Must be able to drive approximately 60-70% of the time within assigned territory. Environmental exposures include eye protection, infectious disease and radiation exposure.

In some locations, testing for COVID-19 may be available and/or required. BD's Corporate Development Department has responsibility for supporting the development and execution of both short- and long-term growth strategies of the Company and partnering with its worldwide business units, regions, and innovation center. Individuals in the Department identify, evaluate, value, structure and negotiate business opportunities including acquisitions, divestitures, strategic alliances, and equity investments. The Department develops and acts as an objective advisor regarding the strategic fit, valuation, and structuring of these numerous opportunities. Individuals in the Department are expected to provide overall project / deal management and, where appropriate, to work with the Leadership Teams of worldwide business units. Finally, the Department is responsible for shaping and executing BD’s corporate strategy as well as developing and maintaining valuation models and transactional, diligence and integration processes.

The Senior Counsel, Commercial Business Units, will be a member of the Global BD Law Group and report to the Assistant General Counsel, Medication Management Solutions (MMS) Business Unit. The successful candidate will partner with the Law Group Business Unit commercial counsels to support one or more of BD’s business units.

Responsibilities:

  • Must possess strong knowledge of corporate and commercial/transactional law and demonstrated expertise in drafting and negotiating complex commercial agreements and advising and counseling clients on a range of business transactions, and in the development of new products and innovations in multiple areas of law focused on the medical device industry

  • Identify and resolve complex legal issues to support the commercial operations of a global leader in the research, development, manufacturing, sales and marketing of BD’s portfolio of products, including developing strong knowledge of supported BD portfolios and clients

  • Provide day-to-day legal advice to the businesses and for the drafting and negotiation of a wide range of commercial agreements

  • Serve as legal reviewer alongside Medical and Regulatory representatives to review and approve advertising and promotional materials; experience with such review in regulated and/or non-regulated settings is strongly preferred

  • Maintain familiarity with laws that affect the medical device industry, including those relevant to sales and marketing of products to health care professionals and reimbursement by government programs, including, for example, fraud and abuse (Anti-Kickback Statute, False Claims Act), FDA regulation (Food, Drug & Cosmetic Act), privacy (HIPAA), security (pre and post market FDA guidance), and anti-corruption (Foreign Corrupt Practices Act)

  • Advise and counsel relating to M&A, partnerships and strategic collaboration, including conducting due diligence, drafting and negotiation of related agreements

  • Develop strong relationships throughout all functional areas, departments, and divisions to foster an advisory or collaborative approach to proactive compliance

  • Collaborate across many functions, countries, cultures, and time zones to drive results on complex projects

  • Represent BD externally to suppliers, partners and customers

Qualifications:

  • Experienced practitioner, with 8 or more years of relevant law firm and/or corporate in-house law department (preferred) experience
  • Hold a J.D. or L.L.M with strong academic credentials from an accredited law school and will have obtained an undergraduate degree from a college or university of recognized standing

  • Admission to the California Bar, and a member in good standing, or eligible to practice as California Registered in-house counsel under California Rules of Court 9.46. required

  • Solid analytical and conceptual skills, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills

  • Superior written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills with an acute ability to listen attentively and to communicate effectively throughout all levels of the organization

  • Ability to present nuanced, complicated, and content rich issues clearly and succinctly

  • Strong interpersonal and relationship skills and ability to influence diverse stakeholders, navigate controversial situations, and change traditional ways of doing business

  • Demonstrated ability to be proactive, exercise independent judgment, and manage multiple projects simultaneously

  • Ability to produce high-quality work under significant deadline pressures

  • Ability to commute into San Diego office location for three days per work week (hybrid model)

  • Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

The Vice President of Strategy, Urology & Critical Care (UCC) serves as a critical member of the UCC Senior Leadership Team. The incumbent reports directly to the WW President, UCC Business Unit.

The role is based in Covington, Georgia and will require onsite presence a minimum of three days per week.

This position will serve as the Strategic Development leader in support of a $1.4+B dollar global business in four primary platforms: Acute Care, Home Care, Endourology and Targeted Temperature Management.

The role will be responsible for understanding the macro-economic environment that BD UCC operates within, the strategies that the Business Unit is striving to achieve, and then proactively ensuring our marketing, pricing, commercial excellence, and business development strategies align with both.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES including the following.  Other duties may be assigned.

The VP of Strategy will advise the Business President and Senior Leadership Team (SLT) on assessing, prioritizing, and driving UCC’s long-term strategic direction and growth across its portfolio.

  • She/he will be responsible for developing a BU level marketing plan, strengthening the organization’s value propositions within and across Platforms, when portfolios have common target customers. Work closely with the platforms and sales leadership to drive marketing discipline, planning and executing in both the portfolio management and go to market strategies.

  • Drive commercial excellence across UCC by leveraging the BD Way of Marketing (BDWoM) and Selling (BDWoS) to evolve our GTM strategies. In partnership with the platforms, lead key strategic initiatives across platforms to deliver the right products at the right price in the right quantities with the right promotional mix for our customers. Work closely with the platforms and functions to ensure that the pricing, lifecycle management, evidence generation, GTM and customer experience strategies are embedded early in the development cycle.

  • Partner with senior leadership team members to unify and establish UCCs global pricing strategy and discipline, leading the cross-functional effort to deliver margin expansion across UCC while establishing the right governance, processes, capabilities, and organizational plans to enable both global platforms and regional teams to deliver against annual pricing improvement goals. Represent UCC at the Global Pricing Council

  • Responsible for identifying, assessing, negotiating, and finalizing new business opportunities that are in line with the overall business and strategic growth objectives for UCC and BD. Work collaboratively with other internal functions to assess market potential, financial viability, technical relevance, and proprietary / legal implications, of all potential new business opportunities. Her/his team will be responsible for completing financial models, preparing, and presenting opportunities to senior leaders, conducting due diligence of targets, and integration activities.

  • Oversee the development of the strategic annual operating plan (ASR) in conjunction with the Platforms and Regions to drive profitable growth, supporting them in delivering plans and removing barriers to execution.

SUPERVISION:

  • Directly manages a Sr. Business Development Mgr.

  • Indirectly leads a global cross-functional team of resources across the business.

  • Maintain leadership presence (hybrid - minimum three days per week onsite) at BD's Covington, Georgia campus.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

  • Bachelor’s degree in law, finance, business administration, marketing, engineering or life sciences (MBA preferred).

  • 10 to 15 years of strategic marketing, pricing, commercial excellence and business development experience in mid to large company in the medical device industry

  • Sales experience is a plus

  • Exceptional negotiating skills along with financial acumen.

  • Thorough understanding of FDA regulations within the U.S. in addition to global laws and regulations related to IP and legal implications with acquisitions of technology, products or companies.

  • Strong global perspective gained through effectively working in a matrixed global environment. Understands global healthcare markets and competitive environment, both developed and emerging.

  • Strong external orientation focusing on customers, policy makers and regulators.

  • Experience in new product design, development, and innovation

  • Experience in developing and executing global initiatives

  • Ability to integrate multiple external factors into a cohesive directional strategy is a needed management skill.

  • Work effectively in a team-based organization, collaborates cross-functionally; effectively demonstrate success in influencing and building cohesive relationships among corporate/functions/platforms/regions

  • Organizationally savvy; proven to be pro-active in an international business environment.

  • Ability to maintain strong relationships with external thought leaders and market trends experts to ensure early identification of opportunity areas.

The Assistant General Counsel, Compliance will be a member of the Ethics & Compliance organization and will report to the SVP, Chief Ethics & Compliance Officer. The successful candidate will serve as the Compliance Officer for at least two BD Business Units, providing counsel on a wide range of compliance matters. The successful candidate will be responsible for executing on BD’s compliance strategy within these business units and for supporting projects and programs for the broader compliance organization as well as other business and functional teams.

This role is a unique opportunity for an individual to serve as a trusted advisor and astute business partner who will collaborate effectively with various stakeholders and leaders to assist the Company in meeting business objectives while ensuring healthcare compliance and mitigating risk. The position requires a superior understanding of the legal and compliance implications of business decisions and will play a significant role in enabling the Company and its professionals to develop and deliver its products and offerings to customers effectively and efficiently, while appropriately managing risks in the heavily regulated environments in which the Company operates. The successful candidate will be a “hands-on” attorney who is able to operate autonomously, yet effectively collaborate across a matrixed organization.

This position will have direct client contact at the business unit leadership level. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to make an immediate contribution to BD’s continuing growth and success. The person sought for this role will be a proven, high potential candidate with strong intellectual, technical and people skills.

Job Description

The responsibilities of the position include:

  • Acting as a leader in Ethics & Compliance and providing compliance risk management oversight and guidance to colleagues in the aligned Business Units.
  • Overseeing a comprehensive compliance strategy and operational approach to establish a culture of accountability and compliance in the aligned Business Units.
  • Serving as a strategic partner to business leaders, sales leaders, and other relevant management personnel on compliance matters.
  • Developing strong relationships throughout all functional areas, departments, and divisions to foster a collaborative approach to proactive compliance.
  • Chairing relevant Business Unit Compliance Committees and other applicable committees to align with key stakeholders on compliance risks and mitigation objectives and elevate key risks/trends to the appropriate business personnel.
  • Maintaining current working knowledge of key laws and regulations, including the False Claims Act, Anti-Kickback Statute, the Sunshine Act and relevant state laws .
  • Proactively understanding the evolution of the compliance requirements and enforcement landscape relevant to the aligned Business Units to proactively address and mitigate regional compliance risks.
  • Providing regular updates on compliance risk management to appropriate cross-functional stakeholder groups within the aligned Business Units ( e.g. , legal, internal audit, finance, regulatory, HR, medical affairs, marketing, sales).
  • Developing and presenting relevant compliance metrics for internal audiences.
  • Conducting, managing, and resolving compliance investigations, as necessary.
  • Supporting compliance due diligence for new business and product acquisitions.
  • Serving as Compliance lead on integration of acquisitions for aligned Business Units.
  • Developing and implementing auditing and monitoring programs to evaluate the company’s compliance with applicable laws, regulations and company policies.
  • Reviewing education and research grant proposals, charitable contributions, and sponsorship.
  • Partnering with leadership to ensure the achievement of strategic business and corporate governance requirements associated with compliance matters.
  • Ensuring proper resource planning and management of outside counsel.

Education / Certifications

  • The successful candidate will hold a law degree with strong academic credentials from an accredited law school and will have obtained an undergraduate degree from a college or university of recognized standing.
  • She/He/They will be licensed in good standing to practice law in at least one state and one federal jurisdiction within the United States without any instances of suspension, revocation, censure or other adverse events in any jurisdiction, whether or not the candidate is currently admitted to practice in that jurisdiction.

Professional qualifications

  • 10+ years of relevant healthcare compliance law experience.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of healthcare laws and regulations, including the False Claims Act, Anti-Kickback Statute, the Sunshine Act and relevant state laws.
  • Experience with federal and state healthcare program reimbursement rules and regulations for medical supplies ( e.g. , Medicare, Medicaid) is a plus.
  • Experience with the legal issues specific to the operation of a durable medical equipment (“DME”) provider is a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with and influence a wide spectrum of individuals: from government officials, to attorneys, executives, associates and agents.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead and/or play a key role in cross-functional project teams.
  • Superior writing skills with an ability to present nuanced, complex and content rich issues in a manner appropriate for the intended audience.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise independent judgment effectively. Ability to draft and implement key corporate policies and procedures to empower and enable associates to achieve business objectives in a compliant manner.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage other associates within the Ethics & Compliance function, and to collaborate with peers and cross-functional partners in a matrixed organization.
  • Tech savvy with excellent presentation, training and people skills.

Summary of Job Responsibilities

The Senior Director, Field Service (FS) will be responsible for ensuring that all service functions are performed to meet or exceed customer expectations in terms of quality, reliability, cost effectiveness and timeliness within the guidelines established by corporate policies, standards, procedures, work instructions and governmental regulations. The FS organization is responsible for providing technical support to customers during installation, operation, maintenance, repair and improvement of medical devices.

Strategic Leadership and Visionary Direction:

  • Develop and articulate the strategic vision and direction for the US Region Field Service organization, aligning with the overall organizational goals and objectives.
  • Lead the development and implementation of innovative strategies and initiatives to enhance service delivery, optimize operational efficiency, and drive business growth through enabling the newly created Scheduled Services organization
  • Provide strategic guidance and direction to senior management and cross-functional teams on field service-related matters, fostering collaboration and alignment.
  • Lead change management strategy and implementation around the newly aligned Dispensing and Pharmacy Automation platforms within Field Serivce, focusing on cross-training and capability building and support with enablement from the also newly created Scheduled Services org

Operational Excellence and Continuous Improvement:

  • Oversee all aspects of field service operations, including service planning, execution, and performance monitoring, to ensure operational excellence and customer satisfaction.
  • Drive continuous improvement efforts by identifying opportunities for process optimization, efficiency gains, and service innovation, leveraging industry best practices and emerging technologies.
  • Monitor key performance indicators and service metrics to evaluate performance, identify trends, and implement corrective actions as needed.
  • Leverage newly created Scheduled Services team to elevate scheduling, WFM, logistics, equipment,etc. capabilities across all product platforms

Stakeholder Engagement and Relationship Management:

  • Build and nurture strong relationships with key stakeholders, including customers, senior management, and internal teams, to understand their needs, preferences, and feedback.
  • Serve as the primary liaison for field service operations, addressing stakeholder inquiries, concerns, and escalations in a proactive and professional manner.
  • Collaborate closely with sales, marketing, and product teams to align service offerings with market demands, customer expectations, and product/service enhancements.

Leadership Development and Talent Management:

  • Lead and mentor a team of field service leaders, professionals, and overall organization over +300 associates providing strategic guidance, coaching, and professional development opportunities to foster a culture of excellence and accountability.
  • Develop succession plans and talent pipelines to ensure a strong leadership bench and continuity of operations, while also promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion within the team.
  • Provide clarity around the benefit of cross training wihthin the Field Service organization, not just for the connection of our customers but for the personal development of associates

Financial Management and Budget Oversight:

  • Develop and manage the departmental budget, ensuring effective allocation of resources and adherence to financial targets, while also identifying cost-saving opportunities and revenue-generating strategies.
  • Monitor financial performance metrics, analyze variances, and provide regular reports and recommendations to senior management for informed decision-making and strategic planning.
  • Partner with finance and accounting teams to ensure accurate financial reporting, compliance with regulatory requirements, and alignment with organizational financial goals.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or additional relevant experience required; advanced degree (e.g., MBA) preferred.
  • Minimum of 12 years of progressive experience in field service operations, including significant leadership roles with demonstrated success in driving strategic initiatives and achieving business objectives.
  • Proven track record of visionary leadership, strategic planning, and execution, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive organizational change.
  • Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills, with the ability to influence and inspire stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a data-driven approach to decision-making and a commitment to continuous improvement.
  • Experience managing complex budgets, financial performance metrics, and operational KPIs, with a focus on maximizing profitability, ROI, and shareholder value.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and familiarity with field service management software/systems.
  • Willingness to travel occasionally as needed.
  • Note: This job description reflects the senior-level leadership and strategic oversight expected from a Senior Director position in field service operations, emphasizing visionary leadership, stakeholder engagement, talent management, financial acumen, and continuous improvement.

Job Title: Staff Process Engineer, Enterprise Change to Win
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The primary responsibilities will include:

  • Leads execution of Specimen Management eCTW projects at manufacturing site.

  • Performs project planning, justification, specification development, and budgeting.

  • Executes MWO’s, engineering studies and validations at manufacturing site.

  • Oversees machine purchase and installations, as well as the building of whole machines or processes.

  • Provides significant leadership for process and machine design of new product/process developments.

  • Identifies significant continuous improvement projects.

  • Provides lead in creativity around solving problems.

  • Generally able to identify solutions to problems encountered without assistance.

  • Works with Plant engineers, management, vendors, consultants, and interfaces with other BD Plants, platform teams, and sales & marketing on development, design, and fabrication of equipment or processes for new products and technologies.

  • Plan and execute activities for multiple major or complicated projects, processes, and equipment without assistance.

  • Willing to travel to other manufacturing sites as needed.

OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES

Other responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:

  • Complies with all local and corporate BD safety regulations policies/procedures.

  • Complies with all corporate and local BD quality policies/procedures/practices through consistent application of sound Quality Assurance principles.

  • Performs other job-related duties as assigned.

Job Description Summary

The Biosurgery WW Platform is responsible for growing the global business reach of BD Interventional Biosurgery product offerings. This intern will provide support to the Global and US Marketing teams as well as assist on multiple cross-functional projects. The ideal candidate for this position is highly motivated to grow within the organization in the future, thrives in an environment of creativity and accountability, and can perform at a high level across a wide array of assignments.

Under the leadership and direction of associates within the Global Biosurgery Marketing team, this semester long internship will offer the opportunity for a student to gain experience by assisting in the execution of internal marketing and sales acceleration initiatives, as well as the analysis of monthly financial documents and organizing data into comprehensible presentations for a leading global medical device company.

This position also entails assisting with regulatory and commercialization activities for new product launches in key regions. The Global Marketing Intern will be responsible for organizing and tracking the Product Release to Market and Country Launch Preparedness (PRM/CLP) process for the release of products into international markets. This intern will also gain exposure to global business, product development, RA systems, and commercial strategies.

The position also offers opportunities to participate in data gathering and analysis, daily meetings with team members, individual monthly country meetings, attend other company meetings, and will have the opportunity to participate in several 1:1 meetings with the leadership at BD to discuss career options in the medical device field.

This position will report to the Senior Global Marketing Manager of Hemostats. This is a paid position.

Job Description Summary

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

About the role

As Global Employer Branding Leader you will be accountable to lead the Employer Branding and Recruitment Marketing strategy and execution to enable BD to attract, hire and retain associates across the globe.

The Talent Acquisition team globally hire approx. 12,000 associates a year across sales, marketing, engineering, clinical, functional, and manufacturing roles based across over 70 countries. Operating as a Centre of Excellence within the HR organization, approx. 200 recruiting professionals are responsible for sourcing, attraction, business partnering, candidate management, employer branding and operational efficiency to attract top talent to BD.

As a member of the Global Talent Acquisition Leadership Team, you will lead a small but impactful team of Employer Brand Specialists in Social Media, Careers Site, Content Creation and Project Management, based around the globe, with the mission of making BD known as an employer of choice and play a pivotal role in our shift to proactive candidate attraction strategies. Responsible to continually develop and implement our global strategy for employer branding, including global EVP maturity build and execution in key areas. Partnering closely with TA, HR, Business and Functional Leadership, especially Corporate Brand, Marketing and Communications, you’ll be a strong influencer with the ability to balance multiple projects and priorities with strong organizational change experience, including ongoing socialization of the importance of brand, EVP and the impact on recruitment strategies.

Main responsibilities will include:

  • Collaborate across the organization to craft, implement, lead and measure employer brand strategies

  • Partner with the business to understand key talent objectives, and ensure branding aligns and enables the strategies

  • Ensure a global to local approach, with branding, messaging and materials that suit a diversity of markets across the globe

  • Continually enhance and implement our global EVP, including executive level stakeholder engagement and socialization

  • Purposefully use recruitment marketing data to tell a story, continually advancing the organizations maturity and showing a clear link back to ROI

  • Proactively seek ways to implement and leverage new and impactful recruitment branding technologies and automation to scale

  • Lead multiple external vendor relationships to ensure a strong partnership and delivery for BD

  • Maintenance, and continued advancement of global careers site

  • Develop positive working relationships with other key functions to ensure alignment of goals and objectives, coordination, and effective collaboration to deliver employer branding outputs

  • Provides Employer Branding leadership, subject matter expertise and consultative guidance

Requirements:

  • A minimum of 6 years’ experience in Employer Branding, in large scale global organizations and developing a function

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

  • Proven experience of EVP design and implementation, across a global organization

  • Demonstrated analytical thinker with the ability to turn challenges into opportunities

  • Exposure to Medical Devices/Life Sciences is not required, but would be advantageous

  • Ability to develop and lead a long-term Employer Branding strategy

  • Demonstrable experience in organizational change and driving new programs

  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and influencing skills, to work with stakeholders from a diverse set of backgrounds

  • Ability to prioritize multiple initiatives simultaneously with strong project management abilities

  • Strong people leader with the ability to motivate, develop and inspire remote teams

Position Summary:

Perform first piece inspections, line audits, non-conforming product holds, and statistical sampling to assure that the manufacturing operations are meeting the quality system and product requirements.  Ensures compliance with BD quality systems, policies, procedures and best practices, and all local, state, federal and BD safety regulations, policies and procedures.  Regular, punctual attendance is an essential job function.  Ability to read and write and converse in English.  Willing and able to uphold BD Values.

Duties/Responsibilities (may not be applicable based on department assignment):

  • Provide guidance and input to manufacturing and management for quality issues.

  • Aide in the training of associates to ensure that they are meeting the quality systems and product requirements.

  • Support C2C compliance activities for the department and self.

  • Support product complaint investigations and corrective actions.

  • Contribute with continuous improvement activities (i.e., Kaizens, blitz, validations etc.).

  • Trend quality metrics and investigate specific problem areas to provide corrective action.

  • Apply and interpret ANSI Z1.4 and other sampling plans for predicting percent defective and lot acceptance criteria.

  • Conduct line audits to assure compliance to the quality system.

  • Develop/assist in creating visual instructions.

  • Conduct proper filing of documentation and react to urgent matters responsibly.

  • Must be familiar with specifications and documentation associated with operations of this position.

  • Comply with plant CGMP and department protective clothing, safety, and management policies.

  • Must be familiar with the quality policy and procedures.

  • Must be able to prepare and control Master Defects for the production lines.

  • Must exhibit and portray the BD Values.

  • Assist in validation processes and conduct machine and process capability studies on equipment.

  • Assist and support team and departmental plant needs and goals.

  • Communicate daily with prior and post shift Quality Control Representatives.

  • Adjustable / flexible work schedule as needed by manufacturing operation requirements

  • Support internal/ external audits.

  • Create/update Quality Notifications in SAP.

  • Create Certificates in SAP.

  • Release products for sale in SAP.

  • Create Global Holds in SAP.

  • Perform first piece inspection of molded parts with the smartscope, optical comparator.

  • Other duties as required to support the needs of the business.

Education:

  • High School diploma/GED required

  • Associates degree preferred

Experience:

  • None required

  • Previous experience with product and process specifications preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Ability to learn methods of various inspection tests, gauges, etc. – Proficient

  • Computer skills including excel, word and power point - Proficient

  • Strong team player exhibiting flexibility and leadership, ability to work independently - Proficient

  • Ability to communicate clearly with all levels of personnel, including customers and auditors – Proficient

  • Good working knowledge of product and manufacturing processes with ability to interpret drawings and specifications preferred

  • Knowledgeable in the fundamentals of quality processes and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) preferred

  • Familiar with process control tools, methods, and inspection equipment/tools (i.e., Comparator, Smart-Scope, Instron, etc.) preferred

  • Fundamentals of Quality System Regulations (QSR) and International Standards of Operation (ISO) regulations preferred

  • Six Sigma knowledge preferred

PCP Level:

  • Hypo department:  PCP Level 2

Job Description Summary

The Senior Quality Engineer is responsible for supporting Design Quality Assurance within the Infection Prevention Platform: Design Controls, Risk Management, Human Factors / Usability Engineering. The incumbent works multi-functionally with teams on new product design, design transfer, risk management, process/product design, quality improvement projects (QIPs) and cost to win (CTW) projects.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

General Functions, Specific Responsibilities, and Authority :

The Senior Quality Engineer works closely with shared functions (e.g. Regulatory Affairs, Designated Complaint Handling Unit (DCHU), Sterility Assurance, etc.), as well as R&D, Manufacturing, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Finance. The Senior Quality Engineer interacts with Regulatory Affairs regarding new regulations and standards as they apply to new product development regulatory submissions and regional expansions, with DCHU on complaint handling/resolution and field actions pre-/post - product launch, Packaging COE on new product packaging projects and changes, Sterility Assurance on sterilization process (re)validations and with Platform Management regarding product design and development, as well as design transfer activities.

Product Development:

  • Provide Technical guidance to Quality Engineers, Quality Technicians, and Inspectors.

  • Support Pre-Concept Front End Product Innovation Process activities for new technologies.

  • Lead Quality Engineering Projects to improve Quality systems and Procedures.

  • Develop and maintain product Design History File (DHF) & Drug Master File (DMF).

  • Development of the Risk Management File in accordance with ISO14971, coordinating input from the other Design Sub-team members including the development of the design, process, and usability FMEAs.

  • Development of Design Verification Protocols and subsequent Design Verification Reports including analysis of all data and decisions on design acceptability.

  • Development of Design Validation Protocols and subsequent Design Validation Reports including an analysis of all data and a decision on design acceptability.

  • Provide input into the project Design Inputs, Design Outputs, Product Specifications, Product Development Plan, and applicable design control documents as defined per BD’s product development process and 21CFR 820.

  • Development of Test Protocols and Final Report to support Regulatory 510K, PMA, (A)NDA, CE mark and International registrations.

  • Determine the degree of Biocompatibility testing required for product changes and new product development efforts as per ISO10993 and company procedures working with BD COEs.

  • Develop or assist in development of inspection and test methods per product specifications.

  • Develop test protocols and release a final report on Shelf Life and Stability Studies in support of expiration dating.

  • Perform test method validations to ensure accuracy, precision, selectivity, sensitivity, stability, and reproducibility of analytical or physical test methods used to assess the safety and efficacy of devices.

  • Develop shelf life and stability test protocols and reports as required.

Process Development:

  • Develop and document the Control System for the manufacture of new products including Inspection Plans for the inspection of components, sub-assemblies and final product.

  • Support the development of manufacturing control plans for internal and outsourced processes.

  • Support (or lead) development of the PFMEA.

  • Perform and/or Support Process Development Studies to determine the acceptability of new processes or equipment.

  • Design and qualify inspection test methods and equipment.

  • Provide Quality Engineering Support to outsourced analytical laboratories and manufacturing facilities to ensure compliance with applicable requirements of 21CFR 820, 210, 211; cGMP’s, CMC, and ISO13485 requirements.

  • Lead supplier part qualification activities including mold qualification and DOEs.

  • Support Process Transfers to the Production facilities.

Other:

  • Support the disposition investigation and decisions of rejected nonconforming components and products; conduct MRB action when required.

  • Organize and generate detailed quality information reports to show trends and the impact of process improvements.

  • Support Design / Process Transfers to the production facilities.

  • Conduct other Quality Control Projects as assigned by the Manager of Quality Engineering.

  • Support the development and effective implementation of Corrective and Preventive Action Plans to resolve quality non-conformances.

  • Perform DOE’s and other statistical analysis to support product and process optimization or determine causes of process variation. Initiate corrective actions as required.

  • Provide technical support to resolve quality problems in development, pilot, manufacturing or with suppliers as warranted.

  • Support goals of the Quality Assurance / Engineering Department.

  • Mentor junior QE staff

Knowledge, Education, and Skills Required :

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Chemistry

  • 5 - 8 years Design Control and Risk Management experience with pharmaceutical, combination products, or medical devices.

  • Pharmaceutical or combination product experience, preferred.

  • ASQ Certified Quality Engineer (CQE) or advanced degree preferred.

  • Experience operating in GLP, GMP, and GDP.

  • Knowledge of statistics and experience with statistical software (e.g. MiniTab), preferred.

  • Attentiveness to details with strong organizational skills.

  • Ability to work proactively and independently.

  • Ability to multi-task and efficient in time management.

  • Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Ability to work in a team environment.

  • Proficiency in Excel, Word, and other desktop/general business systems.

  • Approximately 15 - 20% travel may be required.

Job Title: Sr. Analyst, IT Marketing Technology - Remote
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us!

Want to help BD transform into a digital first company?

The role of the Marketing Technology Analyst will work closely with our digital acceleration team to determine the technology solutions required to enable our digital transformation and making it easy and seamless for customers to do business with us. The successful candidate will work as part of the T echnology G roup S ervices (TGS) team which works in a scaled agile product team structure which provides the necessary agility and flexibility required in this ever-changing space by staying abreast of technology solutions to match our ambitious plans, but also to highlight and propose technology solutions in spaces where we see additional opportunities. With a laser focus on simplicity, customer / user experience and engaging and compelling cont en t, this individual will conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and deliver solutions and monitor ad o ption and ongoing utilization . T his individual will be required to effectively communicate and collaborate with internal and external collaborators to ensure that business priorities are delivered.

This position reports to the Associate Direct or, Digital Marketing, in the TGS business partner team.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

The objective of this role is to actively partner with all relevant collaborators in TGS , the digital accelerator team and external vendors t o complete the associated work deliverables/projects to advance business objectives. Primary responsibilities will include:

  • Earn value-adding, partner relationship maturity for yourself and for the entire TGS function

  • Support identification and definition of new opportunities to use technology and/or process re-design to advance business strategies that directly contribute to driving revenue growth, cost optimization and/or risk mitigation and compliance.

  • Align to strategies for optimal deployment and adoption of new technology capabilities, services, and solutions across the business and/or the end-customers.

  • Advocate for the business within TGS, and advocate for TGS within the business… act as a representative and accountable party for TGS services across business team members

  • Work with other TGS business partner teams and external partner teams to define, document, analyze and prioritize existing and emerging business requirements

  • Complete the projects/improvements/deliverables needed to implement technology, processes, or services to meet business requirements including the documentation, testing and implementation.

  • Develop cases, technology proposals and drive alignment on priorities and needs across both TGS and Marketing teams.

  • Work with and facilitate TGS’ partner teams to ensure delivery provides the desired outcomes.

  • Work with other TGS Business Partners and TGS’ Core Areas of Delivery to ensure that solutions are not siloed and that they are informed by, and are integrated with, BD’s enterprise roadmaps.

  • Complete projects and report progress, including consistent and effective communication, change management impact analysis, readiness and effectiveness, cutover and launch support. This includes handling partner concerns and mitigating risk

  • Measure and communicate value realized on a periodic basis through defined and agreed upon metrics and supporting analysis.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

The ideal candidate will bring a combination of strategic understanding, both business and technology experience, exceptional relationship building skills and solution-oriented mentality together. In addition, this person should also possess :

  • 3 + years of experience in a business including work in one or more of the following technology areas: sales, marketing, customer service, manufacturing, quality and product development processes and operations preferably within a Medical Device, FDA regulated environment.

  • Experience in system development life cycle documentation, testing and release cycle protocols including business requirements documentation, test scenarios/data/execution, cutover, hypercare , project planning and status reporting

  • Proficiency in project management basics: charter, business case development, project management plan and schedule, collaborator management, communication planning, risk/issue management, status reporting and running team calls

  • Ability to communicate complex business / technical challenges in a simplified manner

  • Basic experience and knowledge of change management principles and methodologies

  • Ability to influence change using positive and collaborative methods

  • Highly collaborative work style which includes working effectively across all organizational levels

  • Experience working in a highly matrixed organization and in overcoming ambiguity

  • Leading by example, mentoring, and motivating others all around you

  • A nalytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities

  • Excellent judgment and decision-making

  • Able to align and work with diverse regional partners

  • Strong humility, listening, creativity, and negotiation skills

  • Accept ownership and accountability

EDUCATION

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or business or equivalent relevant work experience required .

For certain roles at BD, employment is contingent upon the Company’s receipt of sufficient proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In some locations, testing for COVID-19 may be available and/or required. Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Position Summary:

  • The DS US Region Medical Science Liaison (MSL) will work with internal and external customers as a field-based scientific and clinical guide who strategically supports communication of medical scientific information relevant to BD products.

    • Focus of this MSL position is microbiology diagnostics (including blood culture, microbiology lab automation, identification, and antimicrobial susceptibility testing), and molecular lab automation

  • The candidate will have in-depth knowledge of in-vitro diagnostics and have a solid understanding of basic science, clinical infectious diseases (with an in-depth understanding and appreciation for sepsis, hospital-acquired infections, and growing antimicrobial resistance), basic microbiology, basic molecular diagnostics, antimicrobial agents, relevant clinical guidelines, general clinical medicine, critical appraisal of the literature, and biostatistics, and a passion for improving patient outcomes through improving diagnostic processes.

  • The MSL will have provide product and field scientific support to Marketing, Medical Affairs (MA), Market Shaping, and Sales by utilizing academic credentials, clinical experience and knowledge, scientific expertise, and their ability to synthesis, simplify and communicate accurate, evidence-based diagnostic information to connect with healthcare providers, academic researchers, and organizations. These relationships ensure that key opinion leaders (KOLs) and organizations have access to relevant scientific information, and that insights captured externally are communicated to key cross-functional partners internally.

  • The MSL will be responsible for staying up to date on the most recent studies that included BD products, evidence related to disease states being tested by BD products, guidelines relevant to the scientific or clinical use of their products, FDA and regulatory body updates, and any additional scientific, regulatory or clinical updates details related to the assigned BD products.

  • Understands the US healthcare system, medical practice, and clinical decision making especially around infectious diseases and institutional programs focused on sepsis, hospital-acquired infections, and increasing antimicrobial resistance.

Functional Responsibilities:

  • Implement strategic, scientific, and educational initiatives to achieve Medical Affairs and Commercial key driver goals

  • Lead scientific exchange conversations to raise disease state and product awareness among healthcare professionals including laboratory professionals, physicians, nurses, pharmacists, and hospital leaders

  • Interact with various customer segments via one-on-one interactions, small group discussions, formulary review committees, and educational symposium presentations.

  • Assist in facilitating KOL involvement in national, regional, and local educational forums including advisory boards, investigator meetings, educational symposia, and sponsored promotional programs

  • Engage with and maintain credible peer-to-peer scientific relationships with national/regional key opinion leaders (KOLs)

  • Heightens awareness of disease management practices and diagnostic standard methodologies and guidelines to healthcare provider and external partners

  • Develop education and training programs for HCP (Healthcare Professionals) and internal BD associates

  • Serve as the medical reviewer and approver for advertising and promotional material

  • Addresses unsolicited off-label questions from the field.

  • Work with medical affairs clinical project leads to disseminate findings from post-market studies related to BD IDS products

  • Work as a partner with global MSL team

  • Work in partnership with medical writing team on manuscript and abstract development

  • Search, track, find, and share competitive intelligence in a timely and appropriate manner

  • Attend assigned scientific and medical congresses to collect information relevant to the organization’s scientific platforms and report this information to internal stakeholders during debrief meetings

Education and Experience

  • Advanced medical or scientific degree required. Preferred: PhD (Microbiology) or MLS (ASCP Certified), PharmD, or MSN/NP with 3-5 years of clinical experience in hospital and inpatient environment or residency trained required

  • Experience guiding, presenting, and communicating scientific or clinical information required

  • Collaborative experience with physicians and other medical authorities to provide education and training to a clinical team for protocol development, process improvement, best-practice training, etc. preferred

  • In-depth experience, knowledge, and skills applicable to clinical diagnostics, infectious diseases, and patient care that can be applied to a wide range of standard and non-standard inquiries and conversations preferred

  • Ability to work resourcefully and independently with minimal guidance

  • Ability to collaborate and work within a cross functional team setting

  • Ability to travel US Region up to 45%

Job Description Summary

The Capital Systems & Services Specialist II position involves managing the customer experience related to BD reusable products, being knowledgeable of all reusable products and processes within the department, from intake through record closure. Additionally, the position requires taking on additional small projects, training others within the department to new process and applications, and assisting coworkers as needed to resolve issues while still maintaining day-to-day activities. The ideal candidate should have effective communication skills, attention to detail, ability to multitask and prioritize work, and knowledge of ISO, Medical Device Directive, and FDA Quality System Regulations. A Bachelor's degree in healthcare, technical or engineering discipline, or three years of direct work experience is required.

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is o ur Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

Position Summary:

The Capital Systems & Services Specialist II is responsible for managing the customer experiences related to BD reusable products.  This position is knowledgeable of all reusable products and processes within the department, from intake through record closure.  While still maintaining day-to-day activities, this position requires the bandwidth to take on additional small projects, train others within the department to new process and applications, and to assist coworkers as needed to resolve issues.

Essential / Key Job Responsibilities:

  • Subject matter expert within area of responsibility. Has advanced and special skills in more than one area/process.
  • Provides oversight of the service record/complaint management process from intake to closure.
  • Knowledgeable of all BD reusable products: functionality, troubleshooting, and failure coding.
  • Responsible for training department personnel on BD applications and processes.
  • Receive and process incoming requests via phone, email, and/or fax.
  • Responsible for accurately documenting all alleged deficiency's and the requested service on BD reusable capital equipment within the electronic service platform system.
  • Accurately assigns IMDRF Annex A failure codes to assist service centers with root cause evaluation/investigation.
  • Responsible for accurately making complaint determination and determining reportability on all reported issues.
  • Responsible for accurately recording and documenting information received from customers and BD employees into the service platform and complaint management systems.
  • Research capital equipment ownership and contract status using JD Edwards ERP system and AS400 contracts application.
  • Research capital equipment service history using legacy trackwise and servicemax service platforms.
  • Accurately initiate and process equipment loaner/replacement movements with the ERP system.
  • Request and coordinate loaner/replacement, packaging materials and return labels for small packages and large crate shipments.
  • Order and maintain packaging materials for magnum loaner and return box shipping requests.
  • Responsible for performing follow up calls to customers, BD employees, and service depots for the return and repair of equipment.
  • Update replacement serial #’s within service records and contract agreements.
  • Perform quality peer reviews of files and close as applicable in a timely manner.
  • Participates/leads is procedure creation and/or CAPA activities
  • Ensure ethical responsibility to maintain privacy and confidentiality of patient records and private information.
  • Complies with all local BD quality policies/procedures/practices through consistent application of sound Quality Assurance principles.
  • Exhibit flexibility and adaptability by managing assignments in accordance with project priorities and by altering course of action when and where necessary
  • Other duties assigned

Required Qualifications:

  • Effective communication skills, written and verbal
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Document Management (MasterControl),
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize work
  • Software application skills.
  • Good organizational and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work in cross-functional teams.
  • Customer Service skills and ability to effectively communication with customers and sales team

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
  • Enterprise (JDE/SAP), AS400 Active Contracts system, Trackwise Complaint Management System, and Trackwise CESC/ServiceMax service platforms.
  • Working knowledge of ISO, Medical Device Directive, and FDA Quality System Regulations

Education and/or Experience:

  • Bachelor's Degree in HealthCare, technical or engineering discipline OR 3 years direct work experience in a reusable capital equipment complaint/service role.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, use sight, and use hands to manipulate, handle or feel objects, tools, controls, and office equipment. The employee frequently is required to verbally communicate with other associates. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel or crouch.

Work Environment:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be in an open cubicle environment.  Candidate must be able to work in a team-oriented, fast-paced environment. BD is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer that values and actively seeks diversity in the workforce.

This job description is intended as a summary of the primary responsibilities of and qualifications for this position. The job description is not intended as inclusive of all duties an individual in this position might be asked to perform or of all qualifications that may be required either now or in the future.

Job Description Summary

Job Description

We are the makers of possible

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.

We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

JOB OVERVIEW:

This role provides business partnering support to the Surgery US Sales & Commercial Excellence team.  The HR Business partner has strong knowledge of HR processes, can effectively partner with the business, acts independently and is responsible for end to end support for the assigned client group. He/she acts as a trusted advisor to the business/functional leader and drives the talent agenda and execution of business initiatives by building capability in the team. In addition to providing HR Business Partner support, this role will also be a key member of the Surgery HR team and provide support fo end to end processes as assigned (e.g. Compensation, Talent, etc.).  The role leverages HR CoEs, the Associate Service Center and Employee Relations to deliver HR tools, processes and relevant data/metrics to the client group. The position reports to the VP of HR for the Surgery Business Unit.

This role provides flexibility to work 3 days weekly on site in Warwick and 2 days remotely, with adjustments to the schedule as needed for business demands.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES AND IMPACT:

  • Acts as a partner to the Leader/Leadership Teams of client groups and other leaders as needed to drive business growth, build talent and advance BD culture. Focuses on being an effective ‘business’ partner by understanding business challenges and pro-actively taking steps to implement initiatives.

  • Engages with business leaders to pro-actively identify people-related issues and initiatives, provide leaders with regular updates on planned activity, advise managers on employee implications of people related business decisions, and act as coach to senior leadership.

  • Responsible for the staffing process by helping drive and build action plans in partnership with Talent Acquisition Team to maintain an active pipeline of talent ensure opened roles are filled timely with the right talent.

  • Apply total reward concepts to attract, motivate, and retain key employees. Providing associates and business leaders with appropriate information on, and interpretation of, compensation and benefits programs and policies. Work in conjunction with the Total Rewards Team to coordinate the annual merit and PIP process, and take part in discussions and reviewing proposals initiated by managers.

  • Facilitate effective performance management practices by helping to define success, establish measurements, provide feedback, and reward performance. Provide guidance and advice to managers on performance issues and issue resolution.

  • Act as an interface with legal and Employee Relations teams to ensure timely resolution of employee relation issues and prevent possible disputes or litigation.

  • Partners closely with the Surgery HR team and Leadership team to ensure alignment across business unit with regards to communication strategy and BU wide initiatives.

  • Responsible for Employee Engagement, Inclusion and Diversity initiatives and Employee Retention.

  • Overall responsible for developing diverse talent in the business / function by creating and executing a plan and by leveraging various forums available across the organization for this purpose.

  • Periodic travel required for business meetings.

  • Sphere Of Influence - The HRBP must be able to build and effectively manage relationships across the matrix. Must pro-actively identify issues that impact their client group, make plans and drive the execution. The HRBP needs to understand and provide inputs into key business decisions like organizational structure and design etc.

  • Strategic Thinking and Problem Solving-The HRBP role requires commercial and strategic acumen to be able to support and coach their leaders. Often times, problems may not always be identifiable and sometimes may be ill defined. The HRBP must have the capability to deal with this complexity and contribute solutions that have significant impact.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in HR Management, Business Administration, or related HR field. MBA preferred.

  • Minimum 6 years of professional experience in Human Resources, preferably in a generalist/HR Partner capacity that required change management, organizational effectiveness/development, policy development and administration, recruitment/selection, compensation, employment law, positive employee relations, performance management, HRIS and/or employee and management training/development.

  • Professional of Human Resources (PHR/SPHR) Certification desired

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook.

  • Workday or other HRIS system experience.

  • Strong HR process and business partnering experience.

  • Strong communication skills, and executive presence.

  • Strong influencing skills across multiple levels, functions and cultures with a sense of urgency and ability to navigate the organizational dynamics.

  • Organization Design and Change Management experience preferred.

  • Building trust and collaboration, Conflict management and Managerial courage

  • Organizational savvy to apply managerial courage and maintain relationships when confronted with complex and/or difficult situations

  • Demonstrated success in translating ambiguous business needs into strategies and concrete team and individual development actions

  • Possesses personal credibility as embodied by proven track record of success, able to instill confidence in others, able to frame complex ideas in useful ways, takes appropriate risks, able to provide candid observations and alternative insights on business issues.

  • Interpersonal and Political Savvy

  • Coaching/mentoring skills
